page.title: 09HOUSING WOODSPRING VILLAGES
page.content: There has been very little housing development in either Wick St. Lawrence or Kingston Seymour over the years and the populations have remained steady for more than a century.The building that has taken place has individual dwellings on an infilling basis.Both have some houses owned by Woodspring District Council and let to families unable to purchase their own homes. They largely replace the tied cottages provided by farmers for their workers. There is concern that the need for housing in Worle, Weston Super Mare and Clevedon will cause these towns to spill over their boundaries and swallow up the village While recognising the need for houses the arguments for development have to be weighed against the loss of farming land and the amenities of open spaces for leisure and recreation.
